Marcus Vinicius Preisighe Viana

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1985889337893269
  • Última atualização do currículo em 26/04/2016

MARCUS VINICIUS PREISIGHE VIANA got his Bachelor of Science (BSc) degree in Aeronautical Engineering by Instituto Tecnológico de Aeronáutica (?Technological Institute of Aeronautics? ? ITA) in 2006. In 2007 he joined the Grupo Especial de Ensaios em Voo (?Flight Test Special Group? - GEEV) nowadays Instituto de Pesquisas e Ensaios em Voo (?Flight Test and Research Institute? - IPEV) to attend the Fixed Wing Flight Test Course at Brazilian Air Force Test Pilot School, in the Aerospace Technology and Science Department (DCTA), in São José dos Campos, São Paulo, Brazil. Graduated as Experimental Fixed Wing Flight Test Engineer he joined the IPEV?s Divisão de Ensaios em Voo (?Flight Test Division? ? EEV). Later in 2011 he got his Master of Science (MSc) degree from ITA in Aeronautical and Mechanical Engineering. Since 2012 Captain Preisighe has been a guest scientist at Institute of Flight Systems of the German Aerospace Center (DLR) in Braunschweig, Germany. His current doctoral research field is integrated model of structural, loads and flight dynamics for flexible aircraft system identification. The objective of his PhD research at the Technische Universität Braunschweig (TU-BS) is to develop a Multipoint Loads Model for Flexible Aircraft Health Monitoring in Real Time. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2015 - Atual
Project Airbus LuFo-4
Descrição: This project has the objective of development of a model of local loads obtained from flight test data, which is envisaged to contribute to correct and update computational loads model that are used by aircraft manufacturers for aircraft design and certification..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Marcus Vinicius Preisighe Viana - Integrante / Per Ohme - Coordenador.
2012 - Atual
Project iLoads
Descrição: The analysis of the loads acting on the aircraft is one of the main tasks for the aircraft development. The knowledge about the loads is essential for the design and research of an aircraft, for example, for dimensioning the structure, but also for its certification. The definition of realistic load assumptions and load analysis are important for simulation and experimental purposes. Due to the high demand of the activities in the field of aircraft preliminary design and technology assessment, and by the operation of a fleet of research aircraft, DLR has to acquire an in-depth knowledge about an integrated analysis of the aircraft loads..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Marcus Vinicius Preisighe Viana - Integrante / Per Ohme - Coordenador.
2008 - 2012
Project Pods
Descrição: Integration of External Stores (Real-Time Airborne Reconnaissance and Airborne Targeting Pods) in a Fighter Aircraft..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Marcus Vinicius Preisighe Viana - Coordenador.
